hero.title: Taverna de la Sal
hero.subtitle: Six intimate rooms in a restored 19th-century building, facing the Mediterranean. Designed for true rest.

story.title: A 19th-century building linked to the sea and salt
story.text: This historic building, tied to L’Escala’s maritime and salt-making heritage, has been carefully restored into a boutique hotel that respects its original essence. Every stone tells a story of sea, wind, and salt.

rooms.title: Six rooms with Mediterranean views
rooms.text: Double rooms of 25–30 m², with a private balcony and partial sea views. Decorated with natural materials and a warm palette designed for rest.
rooms.imageAlt: Room with balcony and Mediterranean views

restaurant.title: Grill, local produce and the Mediterranean
restaurant.text: Our restaurant offers honest cuisine based on grilled meats and fish, seasonal produce and a selection of DO Empordà wines. An intimate setting by the sea to enjoy the best local gastronomy.
restaurant.imageAlt: Restaurant terrace table with sea views

area.title: L’Escala, Costa Brava
area.text: An authentic fishing town on the Costa Brava, where Empúries’ Greco-Roman heritage meets crystal-clear beaches, hidden coves and a unique gastronomic tradition shaped by L’Escala’s famous anchovies.
